definitions.definition: if two or more substances or things mix or you mix them, they combine, usually in a way that means they cannot easily be separated
definitions.sensetop: mix with somethingmix A and B (together)mix A with Bmix A into B

examples.text: Oil and water do not mix.
Oil does not mix with water.
Grief mixed with fear and rage as the people surveyed the ruins of their homes.
Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl.
If you mix blue and yellow, you get green.
I don't like to **mix business with pleasure** *(= combine social events with doing business)*.
Smith often mixed sand into her paint to create a textured surface.
His tears were mixing with the warm water.
Mix yellow with blue to make green.
The students have tried to mix creativity with a social message.
In his world view, art and religion were inextricably mixed.

definitions.definition: to prepare something by combining two or more different substances
definitions.sensetop: mix somethingmix something for somebodymix somebody something

examples.text: With this range of paints, you can mix your own colours.
Be sure to mix the solution properly .
Why don't you mix a cocktail for our guests?
Why don't you mix our guests a cocktail?

definitions.definition: if two or more things, people or activities do not mix, they are likely to cause problems or danger if they are combined

examples.text: Children and fireworks don't mix.
These pills won't mix well with alcohol.

definitions.definition: to meet and talk to different people, especially at social events

examples.text: We've worked together for years but never mixed socially.
They don't mix much with the neighbours.
She mixed happily with the other children.
I don't really mix with people my own age.
a child who mixes well at school
They had attended university together and often mixed socially.
Tourists have the opportunity to mix with the locals.

definitions.definition: to combine different recordings of voices and/or instruments to produce a single piece of music

examples.text: Up to eight tracks can be mixed simultaneously.

definitions.definition: to be/become involved in something, especially something illegal or dishonest

examples.text: Don't tell me you're mixed up in all of this?

definitions.definition: to be/become friendly with or involved with somebody that other people do not approve of

examples.text: He got mixed up with a crowd who were into drugs and crime.

definitions.definition: to combine things in different ways for different purposes

examples.text: You can mix and match courses to suit your requirements.
This mix-and-match approach will appeal to a variety of players.

definitions.definition: to argue with somebody or cause trouble
to do something differently from the way it is usually done

examples.text: The show has been the same for ten years, so it’s time to mix it up.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: back-formation from mixed (taken as a past participle).
